description: OAuth2 authorization endpoint.
label: authentication-oauth2.oa2-authorization-endpoint

description: OAuth2 Client ID.
label: authentication-oauth2.oa2-client-id

description: OAuth2 Client Secret.
label: authentication-oauth2.oa2-client-secret

description: OAuth2 Expiration Override - lets OAuth2 tokens expire after the provided number of seconds (useful to prompt quick `refresh_token` requests for testing)
label: authentication-oauth2.oa2-expiration-override-seconds

description: OAuth2 Redirect URI.
label: authentication-oauth2.oa2-redirect-uri

description: OAuth2 token endpoint.
label: authentication-oauth2.oa2-token-endpoint

description: OpenID Connect Redirect URI
label: authentication-oauth2.oidc-redirect-uri

description: Use OpenID Connect Dynamic Client Registration if the `.well-known/openid-configuration` provides a `registration_endpoint`. If this option is enabled and a registration endpoint is available, `oa2-client-id` and `oa2-client-secret` will be ignored.
label: authentication-oauth2.oidc-register-client

description: Client Name Template to use during OpenID Connect Dynamic Client Registration. In addition to the placeholders available for `http.user-agent`, `{{url.hostname}}` can also be used.
label: authentication-oauth2.oidc-register-client-name-template

description: OpenID Connect Scope
label: authentication-oauth2.oidc-scope

description: Alternative browser session class to use instead of `ASWebAuthenticationSession`. Please also see Compile Time Configuration if you want to use this.
label: authentication.browser-session-class

possibleValues.description: Replace http and https with custom schemes to delegate browser sessions to a different app.
Replace `http` with `mibrowser` and `https` with `mibrowsers` to delegate browser sessions to the MobileIron browser.
Use UIWebView for browser sessions. Requires compilation with `OC_FEATURE_AVAILABLE_UIWEBVIEW_BROWSER_SESSION=1` preprocessor flag.

description: Indicates whether the app should ask iOS for a private authentication (web) session for OAuth2 or OpenID Connect. Private authentication sessions do not share cookies and other browsing data with the user's normal browser. Apple only promises that [this setting](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/authenticationservices/aswebauthenticationsession/3237231-prefersephemeralwebbrowsersessio) will be honored if the user has set Safari as default browser.
label: authentication.browser-session-prefers-ephermal

description: Scheme to use instead of plain `http` when using browser session class CustomScheme, i.e. `mibrowser`.
label: browser-session.custom-scheme-plain

description: Scheme to use instead of `https` when using browser session class CustomScheme, i.e. `mibrowsers`.
label: browser-session.custom-scheme-secure

description: Allow the use of background URL sessions. Note: depending on iOS version, the app may still choose not to use them. This settings is overriden by `force-background-url-sessions`.
label: connection.allow-background-url-sessions

description: Allow the use of cellular connections.
label: connection.allow-cellular

description: Array of allowed authentication methods. Nil/Missing for no restrictions.
label: connection.allowed-authentication-methods

description: Controls whether private links are requested with regular PROPFINDs.
label: connection.always-request-private-link

description:
Rule that defines the criteria a certificate needs to meet for OCConnection to recognize it as valid for a bookmark.

Examples of expressions:
- `bookmarkCertificate == serverCertificate`: the whole certificate needs to be identical to the one stored in the bookmark during setup.
- `bookmarkCertificate.publicKeyData == serverCertificate.publicKeyData`:  the public key of the received certificate needs to be identical to the public key stored in the bookmark during setup.
- `serverCertificate.passedValidationOrIsUserAccepted == true`: any certificate is accepted as long as it has passed validation by the OS or was accepted by the user.
- `serverCertificate.commonName == "demo.owncloud.org"`: the common name of the certificate must be "demo.owncloud.org".
- `serverCertificate.rootCertificate.commonName == "DST Root CA X3"`: the common name of the root certificate must be "DST Root CA X3".
- `serverCertificate.parentCertificate.commonName == "Let's Encrypt Authority X3"`: the common name of the parent certificate must be "Let's Encrypt Authority X3".
- `serverCertificate.publicKeyData.sha256Hash.asFingerPrintString == "2A 00 98 90 BD â€¦ F7"`: the SHA-256 fingerprint of the public key of the server certificate needs to match the provided value.
label: connection.certificate-extended-validation-rule

description: Endpoint to use for retrieving server capabilities.
label: connection.endpoint-capabilities

description: Path of the sharing recipient API endpoint.
label: connection.endpoint-recipients

description: Path of the remote shares API endpoint.
label: connection.endpoint-remote-shares

description: Path of the shares API endpoint.
label: connection.endpoint-shares

description: Endpoint to retrieve basic status information and detect an ownCloud installation.
label: connection.endpoint-status

description: Path of the thumbnail endpoint.
label: connection.endpoint-thumbnail

description: Endpoint to use for retrieving information on logged in user.
label: connection.endpoint-user

description: Endpoint to use for WebDAV.
label: connection.endpoint-webdav

description: Endpoint to use for WebDAV metadata.
label: connection.endpoint-webdav-meta

description: Forces the use of background URL sessions. Overrides `allow-background-url-sessions`.
label: connection.force-background-url-sessions

description: The minimum server version required.
label: connection.minimum-server-version

description: Policy regarding the use of plain (unencryped) HTTP URLs for creating bookmarks. A value of `warn` will create an issue (typically then presented to the user as a warning), but ultimately allow the creation of the bookmark. A value of `forbidden` will block the use of `http`-URLs for the creation of new bookmarks.
label: connection.plain-http-policy

description: Array of authentication methods in order of preference (most preferred first).
label: connection.preferred-authentication-methods

defaultValue: (bookmarkCertificate.publicKeyData == serverCertificate.publicKeyData) OR ((check.parentCertificatesHaveIdenticalPublicKeys == true) AND (serverCertificate.passedValidationOrIsUserAccepted == true)) OR ((bookmarkCertificate.parentCertificate.sha256Fingerprint.asFingerPrintString == "73 0C 1B DC D8 5F 57 CE 5D C0 BB A7 33 E5 F1 BA 5A 92 5B 2A 77 1D 64 0A 26 F7 A4 54 22 4D AD 3B") AND (bookmarkCertificate.rootCertificate.sha256Fingerprint.asFingerPrintString == "06 87 26 03 31 A7 24 03 D9 09 F1 05 E6 9B CF 0D 32 E1 BD 24 93 FF C6 D9 20 6D 11 BC D6 77 07 39") AND (serverCertificate.parentCertificate.sha256Fingerprint.asFingerPrintString == "67 AD D1 16 6B 02 0A E6 1B 8F 5F C9 68 13 C0 4C 2A A5 89 96 07 96 86 55 72 A3 C7 E7 37 61 3D FD") AND (serverCertificate.rootCertificate.sha256Fingerprint.asFingerPrintString == "96 BC EC 06 26 49 76 F3 74 60 77 9A CF 28 C5 A7 CF E8 A3 C0 AA E1 1A 8F FC EE 05 C0 BD DF 08 C6") AND (serverCertificate.passedValidationOrIsUserAccepted == true))
description: Rule that defines the criteria that need to be met for OCConnection to accept a renewed certificate and update the bookmark's certificate automatically instead of prompting the user. Used when the extended validation rule fails. Set this to `never` if the user should always be prompted when a server's certificate changed.
label: connection.renewed-certificate-acceptance-rule

description: Controls whether 307 redirects are handled transparently at the HTTP pipeline level (by resending the headers and body).
label: connection.transparent-temporary-redirect

description: Allows fine-tuning the behavior of the connection validator by enabling/disabling aspects of it.
label: connection.validator-flags

possibleValues.description: Clear all cookies for the connection when entering connection validation.

description: Path of the .well-known endpoint.
label: connection.well-known

description: Concurrency budgets available for sync actions by action category.
label: core.action-concurrency-budgets

description: Add an `Accept-Language` HTTP header using the preferred languages set on the device.
label: core.add-accept-language-header

description: Enable or disable per-process, in-memory cookie storage.
label: core.cookie-support-enabled

description: Override the availability signal, so the host is considered to always be in maintenance mode (`true`) or never in maintenance mode (`false`).
label: core.override-availability-signal

description: Override the reachability signal, so the host is always considered reachable (`true`) or unreachable (`false`).
label: core.override-reachability-signal

description: Minimum number of seconds until the next scan for changes, measured from the completion of the previous scan.
label: core.scan-for-changes-interval

description: Provide hints that thumbnails are available for items whose MIME-Type starts with any of the strings provided in this array. Providing an empty array turns off thumbnail loading. Providing `["*"]` turns on thumbnail loading for all items.
label: core.thumbnail-available-for-mime-type-prefixes

description: Active Host simulation extensions.
label: host-simulator.active-simulations

possibleValues.description: Return status code 404 for every request for the first five seconds.
Return status code 404 for every request.
Redirect any request without cookies to a bogus endpoint for 30 seconds, then to a cookie-setting endpoint, where cookies are set - and then redirect back.
Redirect any request without cookies to a cookie-setting endpoint, where cookies are set - and then redirect back.

description:
A custom `User-Agent` to send with every HTTP request.

The following placeholders can be used to make it dynamic:
- `{{app.build}}`: the build number of the app (f.ex. `123`)
- `{{app.version}}`: the version of the app (f.ex. `1.2`)
- `{{app.part}}`: the part of the app (more exactly: the name of the main bundle) from which the request was sent (f.ex. `App`, `ownCloud File Provider`)
- `{{device.model}}`: the model of the device running the app (f.ex. `iPhone`, `iPad`)
- `{{device.model-id}}`: the model identifier of the device running the app (f.ex. `iPhone8,1`)
- `{{os.name}}` : the name of the operating system running on the device (f.ex. `iOS`, `iPadOS`)
- `{{os.version}}`: the version of operating system running on the device (f.ex. `13.2.2`)
label: http.user-agent

description: The number of seconds that a file hasn't been downloaded, modified or opened after which the local copy is removed.
label: item-policy.local-copy-expiration

description: Controls whether local copies should automatically be removed after they haven't been downloaded, modified or opened for a period of time.
label: item-policy.local-copy-expiration-enabled

description: Number of seconds since the removal of an item after which the metadata entry may be finally removed.
label: item-policy.vacuum-sync-anchor-ttl

description: Controls whether filtered out messages should still be logged, but with the message replaced with `-`.
label: log.blank-filtered-messages

description: Controls whether log levels should be replaced with colored emojis.
label: log.colored

description: List of enabled logging system components.
label: log.enabled-components

description: Determines the format that log messages are saved in
label: log.format

possibleValues.description: A simpler JSON version where details are already merged into the message.

description: Log level
label: log.level

description: Maximum length of a log message before the message is truncated. A value of 0 means no limit.
label: log.maximum-message-size

description: If set, omits logs messages containing any of the exact terms in this array.
label: log.omit-matching

description: If set, omits all log messages tagged with tags in this array.
label: log.omit-tags

description: If set, only logs messages containing at least one of the exact terms in this array.
label: log.only-matching

description: If set, omits all log messages not tagged with tags in this array.
label: log.only-tags

description: Controls whether certain objects in log statements should be masked for privacy.
label: log.privacy-mask

description: Controls whether messages spanning more than one line should be broken into their individual lines and each be logged with the complete lead-in/lead-out sequence.
label: log.single-lined

description: Controls whether log messages should be written synchronously (which can impact performance) or asynchronously (which can loose messages in case of a crash).
label: log.synchronous

description: Turn measurements on or off
label: measurements.enabled

description: List of settings (as flat identifiers) users are allowed to change. If this list is specified, only these settings can be changed by the user.
label: user-settings.allow

description: List of settings (as flat identifiers) users are not allowed to change. If this list is specified, all settings not on the list can be changed by the user.
label: user-settings.disallow
